website_summaries.verdict: Best option for those with hard clay soil.
pros: Made with solid oak and stainless steel
Simply push into soil and drop in bulb
Leather loop makes this easy to hang
T handle for easy use and consistent hole depths
cons: Some owners say the handle eventually breaks off but can be easily repaired

customer_reviews.title: good idea, poor execution
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for planting garlic. the materials are good, appears to be solid oak with the sheath made of stainless steel. But the handle is glued on with cheap rubbery crap and the rivet on the sheath is loose. After twenty bulbs, the handle detached from the shaft. I can certainly fix the problems with about ten minutes in the shop and a little quality epoxy, but its annoying to have to fix a brand new tool before you can use it. Makers of tools like this should have a little pride and ethic about their finished product and have the sense to use glue of a quality equal to the components.
customer_reviews.author: G. Goding

customer_reviews.title: a little sandpaper and some wood glue fixed that pretty quick. Welding on the seam wasn't perfect so ...
customer_reviews.text: Handle came off as soon as I got it, a little sandpaper and some wood glue fixed that pretty quick. Welding on the seam wasn't perfect so there's a gap at the top of the metal cone where it wasn't welded together. Does the job okay, seemed to give me cleaner holes than the other one I used.
customer_reviews.author: DasGrinch

customer_reviews.title: Good tool
customer_reviews.text: We planted 140 bulbs using this tool, the last 50 without the handle. It came off and even gorilla glue didn't help. We tossed it after we were done. For the money it was fine, saved a lot of digging. If I had to plant another 140 bulbs I would probably buy another one.
customer_reviews.author: Oscar

customer_reviews.title: Bad handle  design
customer_reviews.text: Handle twisted off after 10 or so holes. It should have been pinned like the lower steel section. I tried to add a couple if nails to hold it on but I'm not sure if it will hold.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy easy to use dibbler
customer_reviews.text: I didn’t even know what a dibbler was until a friend of mine told me I needed one to deep fertilize my hibiscus plants. It is easy to make a hole in the soil with this tool and drop fertilizer granules down to the root zone. It is sturdy and looks like it will last. A good addition to my potting shed.
customer_reviews.author: Kathy H.

customer_reviews.title: Cheap Crap
customer_reviews.text: Do not buy this product! Broke after just planting 4 bulbs (and it had just rained). I can't express how cheap this product is. If I could give it a 0 I would.
customer_reviews.author: Turk

customer_reviews.title: nice dibble, bad glue
customer_reviews.text: Very nice dibble however like many other buyers the "T" handle pulled right off out of the box. Obviously the Chinese manufacturer has decided that glue is too expensive, also noted the finish was applied to the parts separately then put together, probably why the glue won't hold. Sand off the finish and apply a generous dab of yellow wood glue and it will never come off... easy fix, even a caveman can do it.
customer_reviews.author: Jan Zee

customer_reviews.title: Handle Broke on First Day of Use
customer_reviews.text: I planted about 100 or so bulbs today and used this dibber for the first time ever. I think another user stated this as well, but the handle of the dibber came off towards the end of my work. I hope a little wood glue will fix it, but I don't know how well it will hold on over time and use...the handle and shaft should have been screwed into each other as well as glued, to keep this from happening.
customer_reviews.author: Ana

customer_reviews.title: A great product if...
customer_reviews.text: ...You consider it as "some assembly required." The materials from which this product is made seem quite good and solid -- a hardwood handle and a strong steel tip. However, when the product arrived, I found the cross-handle to be adhered with a very weak glue, and the metal tip was noticeably loose and wobbly on its attaching pins. Upon using a little bit of "Gorilla Glue" or epoxy, one easily turns this into a solid tool. Why the manufacturer doesn't do this is the first place is a mystery.
customer_reviews.author: Bill

customer_reviews.title: Works
customer_reviews.text: Works well, but the handle definitely shipped loose as other people have suggested. May have to glue it back on eventually.
customer_reviews.author: DWB

customer_reviews.title: My dibbler is 80 years old. Bought in England ...
customer_reviews.text: My dibbler is 80 years old. Bought in England when a fellow gardener, who passed about 25 years ago, handed it down to me. When I thought I lost it, I hunted high and low for one that was similar, and these are the same!!! Now I have my original and these two!
customer_reviews.author: llm

customer_reviews.title: Well made, sturdy
customer_reviews.text: This was terrific for my heavy clay soil while planting small bulbs last fall. Great feel in the hand, withoutntiring out the muscles. Highly recommended!
customer_reviews.author: Sybilann Williams

customer_reviews.title: LOVE this
customer_reviews.text: This is the best tool for planting bulbs and small flowers. It is a must have!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: break easily
customer_reviews.text: brock off when I tried to swindle it to the sides... the handle is screw by a little nail to the long axis piece of wood, so no surprise it didn't hold. I had to repair it and put a large screw on top, which allowed me to keep using it.
customer_reviews.author: JG

customer_reviews.title: Arrived Not Properly Riveted
customer_reviews.text: This product showed up with the metal section not properly riveted to the handle, making it insecure and flimsy in use.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Dib! Dib like the wind!
customer_reviews.text: Planted 300 daffodil bulbs with this tool and conscripted child labor (my 9 year old). The tool works great! The child, less so.
customer_reviews.author: caleone01

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use, makes planting simple and fast
customer_reviews.text: Great for planting seeds and bulbs or transplanting your seedings.
customer_reviews.author: justnuts62

customer_reviews.title: Works Great
customer_reviews.text: Strong and durable, great tool for planting bulbs! Love it.
customer_reviews.author: Douglas S. Easton

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Very useful for planting potted annuals. It is fast and does not disturb other nearby plants.
customer_reviews.author: Theodore F. Schneider

customer_reviews.title: Classy clasic
customer_reviews.text: Very comfortable to use and I have had no problems with structural integrety. Hole made in soil is opposite shape of what most rooted cuttings need, but some hole enlargement after insertion should work, unless soil is very firm. An improvement would be depth guide markings but the user could add them with a Sharpie.
customer_reviews.author: T. J. Karasek

customer_reviews.title: Best Bulb Planter Around!!!
customer_reviews.text: I had been looking for a Bulb Planter like this for ages. It is so easy to use and works like a charm! I would highly recommend this Bulb Planter.
customer_reviews.author: Susan Taylor

customer_reviews.title: Cost effective solution
customer_reviews.text: We saw this tool at a gardening store in Petaluma by were turned off by the price. This one is a reasonable price and does the job just as well as the one costing 3 times more. Solid construction with a metal tip that will hold up well.
customer_reviews.author: AllAboutIdaho

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: I have a beautiful little garden I. The back of my house with 6 raised beds. I’m happier when all the rows of plants are lined up properly
customer_reviews.author: Joan Battino

customer_reviews.title: but did a good job with the 4-6 inch ones
customer_reviews.text: Actually not long enough to plant my bulbs 9 inches down, but did a good job with the 4-6 inch ones.
customer_reviews.author: Sparrow

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic!
customer_reviews.text: Very durable and well built. I would highly recommend this tool to plant bulbs of all sizes!
customer_reviews.author: boobear

customer_reviews.title: One Issue Easy to Correct
customer_reviews.text: Like others, I found the handle lose and easily twisted off. A dab of Elmers Wood glue makes this the perfect tool. Take a hint and change out the rubber cement for a good, strong wood glue.
customer_reviews.author: chexem

customer_reviews.title: ... a present for my wife and she thinks its fantastic not having to dig to plant her stuff
customer_reviews.text: Bought this as a present for my wife and she thinks its fantastic not having to dig to plant her stuff.
customer_reviews.author: Mach1run

customer_reviews.title: Handle came loose
customer_reviews.text: Handle came loose fast. Once I fixed the handle it was great
customer_reviews.author: Lisa W.

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic
customer_reviews.text: This is one of the best planting tools I have bought. I plant a lot of small bedding plants, bulbs and cuttings in my garden. This elminates me having to dig a hole. I can push the dibber down in the dirt to the depth I want. If I need a wider hole I just move the dibber around in a circle. I put in the bedding plant and backfill with some gromulch. Wish I had bought this tool years ago.
customer_reviews.author: C. Fox

customer_reviews.title: dibble bulb planter
customer_reviews.text: I ordered it through Amazon. It's an English invention for planting really small bulbs or plants in two inch containers..Makes it SO easy to tuck plants in between other plants. It was pricy but worth every cent . Definitely a wonderful addition to my garden tools.
customer_reviews.author: Mary A.

customer_reviews.title: Disappointing and dangerous
customer_reviews.text: It arrived on time, but...when removed from the package the cross-piece handle fell off. There was no glue visible. When I went to catch the tool, a huge splinter entered my hand and needed to be removed. While the tool looks good, it leaves safety and quality control wanting.
customer_reviews.author: Barbara Allen

customer_reviews.title: Dibble is a Great Gardening Tool
customer_reviews.text: This dibble (aka dibber) is extremely useful for planting bulbs, rows of seeds and small plants (both flowers and vegetables). It gets the plants/seeds in the ground quickly and me off my knees and onto another project fast. I had lost mine somewhere in the yard and looked for a replacement for literally years, but couldn't find one until I checked Amazon.com. I bought one for my sister as well since she is an avid gardener.
customer_reviews.author: Elaine Heinrich

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Works as advertised. Use it to punch holes in ground to insert fertilize tables around my trees and plants.
customer_reviews.author: Max

customer_reviews.title: Best ever
customer_reviews.text: This is the best dibber I have seen or used.
customer_reviews.author: MCN

customer_reviews.title: Will need Glue
customer_reviews.text: The horizontal piece that attaches to the dibble was LOOSE. That is the piece you are supposed to turn as you push the dibble into the ground. Will try glue to attach it properly.
customer_reviews.author: MSP

customer_reviews.title: Have been looking for something like this..........
customer_reviews.text: This garden tool is just what I was looking for and I couldn't find such an item in any of the garden centers. It is sturdy and great for planting and digging and doesn't require a lot of strength to use.
customer_reviews.author: jld76

customer_reviews.title: A real time saver.
customer_reviews.text: This is the ONLY tools to use if you are planting a lot of bulbs or seed. You just poke and plant! I was even able to just kick the dirt in the hole and step on it to tamp it down.w
customer_reviews.author: AHD

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Best one I've ever owned, this tool will be around awhile!
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: I bought this dibber and a larger one. I used this dibber to plant onions and vegetables, it worked great.
customer_reviews.author: David L. Goepfert

customer_reviews.title: Esschert Dibbler
customer_reviews.text: Description of product was very complete and accurate. Delivery was prompt. Product arrived in excellent condition with good packaging. Would absolutely do again. Thanks.
customer_reviews.author: Mainer

customer_reviews.title: Dibber/Bulb Planter
customer_reviews.text: This is a thing of beauty, functional but sculptural. I bought it last spring to plant freesia bulbs. I was delighted to unwrap it and and hold it in my hands. It's solid oak w/ a metal wrapped tip. It made planting the bulbs an effortless task (they were in containers and the soil was soft, but still) and was as much a pleasure to look at as to use.
customer_reviews.author: Toni Mayer

customer_reviews.title: Good for small bulbs
customer_reviews.text: This is a helpful tool for smaller bulbs and if the soil is in relatively good shape. Our soil has a lot of clay in it, so I had a little trouble pushing this into the ground. I also wished the handle on top was wider so I could hold the handles and push with my entire hands; I was basically pushing with my palms, and they got sore.
customer_reviews.author: Sammy

customer_reviews.title: It's OK
customer_reviews.text: This dibber works ok, although the metal end is not secured especially well and wiggles a bit. I might like a one piece dibber better.
customer_reviews.author: Sharon Molnar

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use
customer_reviews.text: This worked great for our planting. It is easy to use and carry. The holes are perfect after using this.
customer_reviews.author: MrsG

customer_reviews.title: So easy to use and so helpful.  Saves a lot of work.
customer_reviews.text: I like to plant small bulbs with this, and also to put fertilizer deep down where the roots are, this makes a small deep hole, and the fertilizer can be put in the hold close to the roots. Very efficient.
customer_reviews.author: Park Bishop

customer_reviews.title: Good dibber
customer_reviews.text: Love my dibber but just as others have said the top of the handle is not glued on well. But a small amount of wood glue is ready to go.
customer_reviews.author: Nancy

customer_reviews.title: dibber
customer_reviews.text: I recently planted 300 glory of the snow bulbs in the front yard with this dibber. I have mostly clay soil yet found this tool easy to use and very sturdy. It is an excellent tool for planting small bulbs.
customer_reviews.author: Gloria

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: broke after two hours - the top part came off
customer_reviews.author: nimamay518

customer_reviews.title: Satisfied with the Dibber
customer_reviews.text: A handy tool to assist with planting smaller bulbs. The dibber is well made and the handle is well attached.
customer_reviews.author: DV

customer_reviews.title: Gardening Tool
customer_reviews.text: Depending on what you are planting, this is a handy tool to have with your gardening equipment - it's great for planting garlic and onions. Planting bulbs of any sort would be quite easy with this handy gadget!
customer_reviews.author: R. Moxon

customer_reviews.title: but feel it will do the job nicely.
customer_reviews.text: I wish it were wider, but feel it will do the job nicely.
customer_reviews.author: Bernice Jasper

customer_reviews.title: like it
customer_reviews.text: Comes in handy for planting small bulbs. Tried useing it for planting annuals. Not so good. Have had it for months and not a sign of rust. Holding up good.
customer_reviews.author: frances butterbaugh

customer_reviews.title: Unique, well made garden tool
customer_reviews.text: I own a similar tool, purchased when I lived in the UK years ago. A friend saw and admired mine, so I searched out this item on Amazon. It arrived promptly and is impressively well made. My friend was thrilled with her gift, and undoubtedly will be using it for decades.
customer_reviews.author: Viane Frye

customer_reviews.title: Three Stars
customer_reviews.text: Good for little bulbs but not for big ones like tulips, etc.
customer_reviews.author: Momathome

customer_reviews.title: handle came off first time it went into the ground
customer_reviews.text: This would be a perfect garden tool if the handle were permanently attached to the stick (dibber). Unfortunately the handle is glued on and popped off the first time I stuck it in the ground. Might as well use a broom handle or tire iron.
customer_reviews.author: bbbbbccccc

customer_reviews.title: Great tool
customer_reviews.text: Great tool. It's just what I was looking for. Saw a local garden expert using it and ordered it after he recommended it. It was just like the one he had and his was well worn.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Looks great - have not been able to use but looking forward to it.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Little

customer_reviews.title: Lovely finish, truly durable and best dibber yet.
customer_reviews.text: I've used a number of different dibbers over the years. When I placed this order, I also ordered a cute plastic orange carrot dibber for my granddaughters' garden tool collection. The quality and craftsmanship of this dibber is superb and I appreciate the ergonomic design and functionality of this gardening implement. This was a pleasant surprise and will be ordered again as a gift for my gardening family members. Planting garlic bulbs, hyacinth bulbs and tiny seeds are so much easier with this dibber.
customer_reviews.author: Isa V-J

product_meta.title: Esschert Design Dibber/Bulb Planter
product_meta.description: This dibber is the perfect tool to make easy work of planting seeds or bulbs. T-handle for ease of use and consistent hole depth. Wooden handle. Leather loop for storage.

specifications.Domestic Shipping: Item can be shipped within U.S.
specifications.International Shipping: This item can be shipped to select countries outside of the U.S. Learn More
specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.5 out of 5 stars140 ratings4.5 out of 5 stars
